706792f-b.text:
(1)
Shore Road, east side, north of 99th Street, showing in the foreground the house occupied in 1852 by General Stanton. (It was still in the Stanton family in 1873). The follewing are families which lived in or owned this house at one time or another; Walter E. Shuttleworth in 1915, Major Thomas L. Johnson of Cleveland, Henry George, George F. Gibson and William Stillwell. The center house is No. 1085 Shore Road.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing only the first house.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.

706793f-a.text:
(1)
Shore Road, east side, at 99th Street. The house at the left, said to be the home of General Henry Stanton whose estate was bounded by
Shore Road, 97th and 99th Streets and Marine Ave.
1920.
Eugene L. Arniruster Collection.
(2)
The same, showing the Johnson house in the foreground, said to be
the Stanton house modernised.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
